intro: Veronica mampodrensis, commonly known as the Malagasy speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It has hairy leaves and produces numerous small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
